qas.question: How did Gaddafi staff the RCC members?

answers.text: All young men from (typically rural) working and middle-class backgrounds, none had university degrees;

qas.question: Why did Gaddafi select these men as RCC members?

answers.text: they were distinct from the wealthy, highly educated conservatives who previously governed the country.

qas.question: Whose face was most closely associated with Libya's new government?

answers.text: some of the others attempted to constrain what they saw as his excesses

qas.question: On what date were the members of the RCC announced?
How many members of the RCC had graduated from university?
What was the general age group of the members of the RCC?
What was the sex of all the members of the RCC?
Along with the working class, what was the class background of RCC members?

context: Although theoretically a collegial body operating through consensus building, Gaddafi dominated the RCC, although <a3_0>some of the others attempted to constrain what they saw as his excesses<a3_0/>. <a2_0>Gaddafi<a2_0/> remained the government's public face, with the identities of the other RCC members only being publicly revealed on <a4_0>10 January 1970<a4_0/>. <a0_0>All <a6_0>young<a6_0/> <a7_0>men<a7_0/> from (typically rural) working and <a8_0>middle<a8_0/>-class backgrounds, <a5_0>none<a5_0/> had university degrees;<a0_0/> in this way <a1_0>they were distinct from the wealthy, highly educated conservatives who previously governed the country.
